data.title: Fix creator-defined statement prediction
data.body: Completed the fix for #292: `UserStatement.predict` uses the return value from `UserStatement.call`, but that method did not return anything.

data.title: "nvl show" and "nvl hide" argument is not optional
data.body: According to the documentation (see #510), `nvl show` and `nvl hide` take an optional transition argument. However, `parse_nvl_show_hide` will generate an error if the argument is missing.

data.title: Window show bug.
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=34512

data.title: Text.size() calls non-existent method Layout.unscale()
data.body:
The `size` method on the `Text` class ends by calling `layout.unscale(layout.size)`, but there is no `unscale` method on the `Layout` class.

Possible fix: `layout.unscale_pair(*layout.size)`.

data.title: In Launcher, hotkey "r" runs the current project
Searching the images/ directory may not work on Android. (Or in .rpas?)
Newlines surrounding {fast} tag disappear
data.body:
When you have `\n` on both sides of a `{fast}` tag, one of them seems to get lost somewhere until the text being shown is updated. Using this code on 6.99.6:

`spk "\n\n　Line 1.\n{fast}\n\n　Line 2.{w}\n　Line 3."`

Gives me this:

![screenshot0006](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/680110/10125566/d62db69c-653e-11e5-89d4-73769d54cf13.png)
![screenshot0007](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/680110/10125567/d9b3296e-653e-11e5-8bc6-27f575b87328.png)

data.title: Treat all screen prediction as slow.
data.body: Right now, we're calling predict_screen when predicting a say statement, and thus predicting it immediately - even when fast prediction is going on. We should defer this until slow prediction is allowed.

data.title: Issues with SL and Viewport.
data.body:
I've reported this on the forum: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=34185 but that seemed to be a useless action without a single response.

``` python
screen testing_scr():
    viewport:
        align (0.5, 0.5)
        xysize (360, 400)
        scrollbars "vertical"
        has vbox spacing 3

        for item in xrange(10):
            add Solid("F00", xysize=(350, 100))

label start:
    call screen testing_scr
```

There is no alignment.

``` python
screen testing_scr():
    viewport:
        pos (0.5, 0.5)
        xysize (360, 400)
        scrollbars "vertical"
        has vbox spacing 3

        for item in xrange(10):
            add Solid("F00", xysize=(350, 100))

label start:
    call screen testing_scr
```

Positioning and the bar are messed up.

``` python
screen testing_scr():
    viewport:
        xysize (360, 400)
        scrollbars "vertical"
        # side "l"
        # or
        # side_vbar "l"
        has vbox spacing 3

        for item in xrange(10):
            add Solid("F00", xysize=(350, 100))

label start:
    call screen testing_scr
```

No argument can be passed to a side (assuming that one is created by ui/SL code).
# 

http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#viewport

Adding a container like a Box or a Side seems to help the issue a bit but there are still clear misrepresentations of this really would be nice to have feature in the documentation...

data.title: the apk does not work on low-end phones
data.body:
I've always used two methods to test app created with Ren'Py

Use the Bluestack (android emulator for Windows) and use my phone Galaxy Young GT S5360L with android 2.3.6 to test the app created with ren'py

The problem is that in recent updates, RenPy 6.99 on, the game menú buttons on my phone hardly respond (I usually use large buttons for my application)

That has not happened with previous versions of RenPy

The app in Bluestack works well.

I hope you can help me with this little problem.

data.body:
Here's trackback:

Full traceback:
  File "game/android.rpy", line 445, in script
  File "F:\Ren'py_SDK_Nightly\renpy\ast.py", line 797, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "F:\Ren'py_SDK_Nightly\renpy\python.py", line 1448, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/android.rpy", line 447, in <module>
  File "F:\Ren'py_SDK_Nightly\rapt\buildlib\rapt\install_sdk.py", line 263, in install_sdk
    get_packages(interface)
  File "F:\Ren'py_SDK_Nightly\rapt\buildlib\rapt\install_sdk.py", line 186, in get_packages
    with open(plat.path("android-sdk/extras/google/play_apk_expansion/downloader_library/project.properties"), "r") as f:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: "F:\Ren'py_SDK_Nightly\rapt\android-sdk-r23/extras/google/play_apk_expansion/downloader_library/project.properties"

This happens when RAPT finished extract Android SDK and tried to fetch SDK lists.
Ren'py SDK version is 6.99.6.749

data.title: MoviTransition disables key
data.body:
I used below screen.

```
        screen say(who, what, side_image=None, two_window=False, centered=False):
            key "h" action [With(MoveTransition(3, leave=Transform(ypos=1.5, yanchor=1.0),layers=['screens'])),HideInterface(),With(MoveTransition(3,enter=Transform(ypos=1.5, yanchor=1.0),layers=['screens']))] 
     .
     .
     .
```

I pressed "h" and the screen was hiden with movetransition.
I pressed "h" and the screen was shown with movetransiton.
But, I pressed "h" again and the screen was hiden with none transition.

data.title: Generator issues?
data.body:
Since generators cannot be pickled, is there any good workaround for this? What is REALLY weird is even if the generator is deleted, there are still issues with saving/console :(

``` python
init python:
    from itertools import count

# The game starts here.
label start:
    $ c = count()
    "Save or call Console"
    return
```

data.title: Externals directory.
data.body: A place for pure-python dependencies that can be pip-installed to.

data.title: Ren'py windows gets "urgent" status after switching virtual desktops on X11
data.body:
This happens both on launcher and game windows, unless a window is minimized. Not sure if that was introduced on purpose or happens as a side effect, but it's quite annoying, especially when developing.

Reproduction:
1. Open Ren'Py window on one desktop.
2. Put another window on top of it.
3. Switch to another virtual desktop
4. Switch back. Ren'Py window is urgent (e.g. highlighted on task bar)

data.title: auto-forward broken in nightly
data.body: "Auto" mode does not auto-forward until auto-forward time is set (in preferences probably).  Time defaults to minimum but is apparently undefined.

data.title: Text spacing problems
data.body: Show up in sunrider academy. Potential solution might be to size text in virtual res, and use that to get the size of the Render.
